attributes.title: Physical Stock Take
attributes.description:
1. Physical Stock Take

Findings.

·       A stock take was conducted on 6 March 2025 to establish whether the physical stocks were matching with the stock book balance generated from SAP system and whether internal controls on stocks were effective.

·       The physical stock count revealed minimal variances when compared with the system's recorded balance for almost all stock items. However, notable discrepancies were observed in the following categories:

·       Packing Materials: Variance of +294 pieces.

·       Bread Stock: Variance of (41) pieces

The table below illustrates the findings:
attributes.recommendation: ·       Strong controls on Stocks should be adhered to in order to minimize the variances.
attributes.effect:
·       The zero variances suggest strong control and accurate tracking of inventory.

Minor Positive Variance in Vegetable Oil, Packing Materials & Jerricans. These variances are not significant enough to raise major concerns. Controls are effective.
attributes.remediation_plan: The excess surplus of polybags indicates a weakness in inventory controls. This can be addressed by ensuring that the receiving personnel verify the weight (kg) indicated on the package against the actual weight after performing a physical count and weighing of the items. This process helps to ensure accuracy in inventory records and improves control over stock discrepancies.

value:
·       The manager and team should improve on quality controls to avoid returns.

The polybags bundles should be weighed to ensure they are of correct weight in Kgs before been stored.

The slight short in bread stock was affected by market returns. However, we will strengthen the controls.

I shall control variance on polybags by verifying before receipt.

·       In the prior Audit, the following were stock findings; A variance of 1 Bag of 25Kg was noted in the baking flour.

Ø  There was 879 pieces of polybags 400g White that was already coded (MFD: 27/12/2024 and BBD 31/12/2024). These polybags were included in the physical stock though they can never be used. Bread variance was -48 and polybags +49.
Previous
• The minimal variances noted imply adequate stock controls at the branch, however the bread shortfall was an indication of lapses in monitoring and verification of actual yield.
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Weight Check
attributes.description:
1. Bread Weights

Findings.

·       We conducted Bread weight spot checks on 6 March 2025 on packed bread ready to be dispatched to the market to determine whether the bread dispatched to the market meets the required weight standards.

·       From the selected sample, bread Overweight were noted in

     Overweight Products:

·       200g WB : 19% overweight

·       400g White : 9% overweight
attributes.recommendation:
Strict adherence to set standard dough weights in order to attain standard weight bread.

The branch management to increase spot checks in the production area and ensure that the workforce is trained on the required weight standards and weighing procedures.
attributes.effect: Overweight bread lowers yield targets hence revenue targets not realized.
attributes.remediation_plan:
To ensure all bread varieties comply with the required weight standards, reducing instances of underweight and overweight products, thereby maintaining regulatory compliance and customer satisfaction by

  • Enforce strict weight control measures at the production level.

  • Conduct regular calibration of weighing machines.

  • Increase spot checks on packed bread before dispatch.

value: Follow the procedures as required.
I will supervise the production team to ensure procedure is followed to minimize cases of Overweight and Underweight breads.

·       In the prior audit, we noted the following   Under weights bread;

Ø  2W – 13%

Ø  4W – 3%
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Damages Analysis
attributes.description: ·       It was observed that production-related damages were within the established limits, limits, as illustrated below.
attributes.recommendation:
1. To adhere to the set quality control parameters within the production process to minimize production damages.

  2. Bread production should be aligned with actual sales demand to prevent overproduction and reduce market damages.
attributes.effect: Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that controls on damages are effective and do not expose the company to losses.
attributes.remediation_plan:
Issue: Market damages were close to the limit.
Remediation Plan:

  • Align production with actual sales demand to prevent overproduction and Strengthen sales forecasting models to minimize market damages.

value: Controls will be strengthened even more.
Effective Controls will be maintained.

·       In the prior

Audit During

this

period,

Production

damage was

0.22%

and

Market Damage

was 0.17%.
Previous
The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within the set limits.
The production and market damages were within the set limit.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring controlled bread damages.

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.recommendation: The branch should work towards achieving the set production target and set consumption standards.
attributes.effect:
·       The Average yield was within the set target.

·       75% target achievement indicates that the branch is not meeting its production targets by 25%. This could be due less orders and cutting down production.

  • Minor variances between Mixing chart and SAP are an indication of good controls.
attributes.remediation_plan:
Issue: Not achieving set production Target

Remediation Plan: The operations should collaborate with sales team to ensure the branch get enough order.

value:
We will maintain controls on Yields and verification of Mixing chart records.

However, we will work toward achieving the set production target.
The production target is achievable; however, cutting down production led to not meeting the set target.
·   In the prior Audit, no material variance between Sap and the Manual Mixing Chart.
Previous
Comparison of manual mixing charts and the SAP mixing charts was done from 1st to 28th February 2025 to find out Manual Mixing Chart was matching with SAP System.
Set Yield, Consumption was observed apart from set production target which was not achieved due to cut production.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the set Yield, Consumption of Raw Materials and Production Bags is achieved.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency Analysis
attributes.description:
·       Production efficiency was calculated for a period of 28 days from 1February 2025 to 28 February 2024 on 7 March 2025. The aim was to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 4.5 bags.

·       The actual efficiency of 4.48 bags per worker is slightly below the KPI of 4.5 bags per worker, indicating a minor underperformance in terms of productivity.

A summary of the analysis is shown below;
attributes.recommendation: ·       Continue to monitor production efficiency regularly. Even small improvements in worker output can lead to better overall productivity and cost savings in the long run.
attributes.effect:
The slight underperformance in production (7.5 bags) may indicate that the workers' effort is slightly lower than expected. However, since the shortfall is minimal, the cost impact is negligible. 

No extra workers are needed since the current workforce is already producing close to the expected output.
attributes.remediation_plan:
To improve production efficiency and optimize resource utilization, the following remediation plan is recommended:

  1. Workforce Optimization: Align staffing levels with actual production needs to minimize unnecessary labor costs.

  2. Performance Monitoring: Track production efficiency metrics regularly and implement corrective actions when targets are not met.

  3. Equipment Maintenance: Conduct routine maintenance and timely repairs to prevent equipment breakdowns that impact productivity.

value: We are working to maintain set target.
The production Efficiency was close to KPI. However, I will ensure it is improved to higher efficiency.
·       In previous audit, the production Efficiency was 4.4 Per worker
Previous

This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs. Standard production efficiency is 4.5bags per staff.
Adherence to set production efficiency.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring set production efficiency is adhered to.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description:
Findings:

·       A spot check was conducted in the mini shop on 6 & 7 March 2025 to assess whether the operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.

·       The physical quantities of various varieties were compared to the DDS balance, and the variance was calculated to identify any discrepancies.

·       It was noted that there were no variances between the physical quantities and the DDS balances for all the minishops i.e. Barsheba, Kongowea, and Bombolulu Minishop.
attributes.recommendation: The company continues to follow strong reconciliation procedures between the physical counts and the DDS balances, to ensure ongoing accuracy and to catch any potential discrepancies early on.
attributes.effect: The consistency between physical stock and DDS data implies that the internal controls governing the stock counting and recording processes are effective.

value: Controls are effective and will be maintained.
Strong controls will be maintained.
In the prior Audit, all the 3 Minishops correctly accounted for their stock
Previous
A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
Mini shop SOPs are followed.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure that all bread loaded at the mini shop is well accounted for and mini shop SOPs are strictly adhered to.

attributes.title: Vehicle Mileage & Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description: ·       The purpose of this audit was to assess and analyze the fuel consumption of the branch sales vehicle for the period from 1 February to 28 February 2025 done on 7 March 2025. The primary objectives were to evaluate compliance with fuel efficiency standards, identify any areas of inefficiency, and recommend strategies for reducing fuel consumption and associated costs.
attributes.recommendation: Updated Standard fuel consumption rate should always be recorded on Managers book for easy access.
attributes.effect: Low fuel consumption implies the controls are effective.
attributes.remediation_plan: Check on the standard consumption rate if it need to be revised.

value: We will maintain controls.
Noted.
·       No Previous findings.
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file.
Economical fuel consumption
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring that all sales vans fuel consumption is as per set standards.

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
·       Fuel consumption tests were carried out on 7 March 2025 to determine if set consumption standards for generator was adhered to. Standard fuel consumption for the branch generator was 18.35L/Hr.

·       The Generator is consuming more fuel than the set standard, with a difference of (2.35) liters per hour.

·       It was also noted that the Agana system is not reliable and provides inaccurate information.
attributes.recommendation:
·       It's essential to track he generator's average fuel consumption regularly and compare it with standard fuel consumption of the generator.

The Agana system should be examined or tested to ensure it works consistently and accurately.
attributes.effect: The generator consumption was slightly above the set standards. This implies the generator is not saving.
attributes.remediation_plan: The operation to do regular check on the consumption of the generator.

value: The consumption rate is close to the set standard.
The consumption is okay.
In the previous Audit, Consumption rate was 31.67.
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by s and generator was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file.
Fuel controls should be strengthened.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure economical fuel consumption (Generator).

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description:
·       Verification of cash held at the cash office was done on 6 March 2025, to confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to.

·       During the cash count, the variance noted was minimal as illustrated below.
attributes.recommendation: ·       Proper reconciliation procedures must be maintained to ensure accuracy and integrity of the cash records.
attributes.effect: The cash balance seems to be accurate, with only a small discrepancy of KES (60).

value: Minimal variance indicates strong controls.
·       Cash control will be maintained.
·       In the prior audit Report, no material variances were noted on the spot check
Previous
Physical cash was verified on 06/03/2025 to check whether cash counted matched that on SAP balances.
Minimal cash variance suggest effective controls were put in place.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Cash Controls are strong.

attributes.title: Debtors Analysis
attributes.description:
·       An analysis of the debt balance as at 6 March 2025 was performed to identify any occurrences of bad debts or unresolved balances by route.

·       During the audit, it was noted that there were no balances.
attributes.recommendation: ·       Continue adhering to company policies.
attributes.effect: No balance implies the controls are effective.
attributes.remediation_plan: Dormant accounts balances should be written off or thorough foll up on Debtors .

value: Noted.
I will maintain proper controls.
No previous findings.
Previous
Confirming debtors' balances and their security Deposits are according to the company policies.
Policies are adhered to.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure no outstanding balances.
